channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Iran test launches new satellite-carrying rocket
item.description: Tehran refutes US concerns that the same long-range ballistic technology could also be used to launch nuclear warheads.

item.title: Who needs what in Group 2 to reach the T20 World Cup semis?
item.description: Five of the six teams in Group 2 are still in the running for a top-two place and a spot in the semi-finals.

item.title: Attack on UK immigration centre ‘terrorist’ incident, police say
item.description: The firebombing of a processing centre in English town was ‘motivated by a terrorist ideology’, police say.

item.title: Iran’s embattled currency plunges to historic lows amid protests
item.description: Rial hits a new all-time low amid ongoing protests and a lack of progress on the revival of the nuclear deal.

item.title: French far-right RN picks Jordan Bardella as Le Pen successor
item.description: Jordan Bardella, a 27-year-old Le Pen protege, won nearly 85 percent of RN party members' votes.

item.title: England beat Sri Lanka to book T20 World Cup semi-final spot
item.description: Win sees England through to the semis, while hosts and defending champions Australia are knocked out.

item.title: Nike suspends ties with NBA’s Kyrie Irving over anti-Semitic film
item.description: Nike suspends its eight-year relationship with Brooklyn Nets guard after he apologised for promoting anti-Jewish film.

item.title: The 10 football World Cup heroes
item.description: Ahead of Qatar 2022, here is a list of 10 biggest players to have played the World Cup.

item.title: US may elect first Muslim senator. Why are few Muslims thrilled?
item.description: Donald Trump-backed Mehmet Oz's Senate bid fails to produce enthusiasm seen with previous Muslim firsts in US.

item.title: Climate emergency: Will polluting rich nations pay reparations?
item.description: Group of 134 developing nations plans to fight at climate summit for a crucial loss and damage financial facility.

item.title: Russia bar blaze kills 13; suspect with flare gun detained
item.description: Authorities launch criminal proceedings after man allegedly fired a flare gun, setting the nightclub on fire.

item.title: K-pop band’s concert in Indonesia halted after 30 faint in crush
item.description: Incident comes weeks after more than 130 people, including 40 children, died in a football stadium crush in Java.

item.title: Iran confirms drones to Russia but ‘months’ before Ukraine war
item.description: Tehran says it ‘won’t be indifferent’ if Russia is proven to have used its unmanned aerial vehicles in the war.

item.title: Malnutrition woes overwhelm children in northeast Nigeria
item.description: Over 1.3 million children under 5 are likely suffering acute malnourishment in northeast Nigeria, according to the UN.

item.title: US accuses Russia of trying to ‘freeze’ Ukraine into submission
item.description: Antony Blinken says if Vladimir Putin is unable to take Ukraine by force he will try to 'freeze it into submission'.

item.title: At least one killed after tornadoes hit Texas and Oklahoma
item.description: Twisters rip through parts of Texas and Oklahoma, injuring dozens and destroying homes and buildings.

item.title: Killing journalists: Qatar expresses ‘deep concern’ over impunity
item.description: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was shot dead by an Israeli sniper in May but no one has been held accountable.

item.title: Lula’s comeback: Can he pull Brazilians out of poverty?
item.description: Leftist leader Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is set to govern Latin America’s biggest economy for a third time.

item.title: US flies supersonic bomber in show of force against North Korea
item.description: At least one B-1B aircraft participated in joint US-South Korea air force exercises, Seoul says.

item.title: Finland’s President Niinisto: In poker terms, Putin went ‘all in’
item.description: Sauli Niinisto discusses Russia’s possible reaction following his country’s pledge to join NATO.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 255
item.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 255th day, we take a look at the main developments.

item.title: ‘Nuclear wars must not be fought,’ China President Xi says
item.description: Statement from Chinese leader Xi Jinping comes after a series of threats as Russia's war in Ukraine intensifies.

item.title: US midterms: Why abortion never gets old as a hot election topic
item.description: In the self-appointed land of the free, reproductive freedom was never fully born. You might even say it was aborted.

item.title: Five football matches you should not miss today
item.description: From La Liga and Serie A to MLS Cup final, here are today's top football matches.

item.title: Lobbying, clashes and Brazil’s supremacy at FIFA World Cup 1962
item.description: Argentina seemed favourites to host but Chile lobbied FIFA's member nations and eventually landed rights to host it.
